Posts.Content: Hi ruby, I think I saw another post on here in that  might help and it said, go out, go out a lot, keep busy do anything, to keep,busy.  I know advice like that helped me honey, the waiting is big fat pants and I agree that it seems unfair that you are hanging about while your consultant is laying by the pool in his budgie smugglers!  Perhaps ask your breast care nurse if someone else could give you your results in his absence?  Good luck ruby and let us know how you get on.  Love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: mammo found clusters of microcalcifications. Very scared!

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Ali, yours is the same day as my sistersXxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi hawkster, the waiting is pants that's for sure! Good luck tomorrow, i remember this day in my cancer journey and I was a wreck, but, you might find you feel a lot calmer tomorrow.  Do whatever it takes to get through it and let the stress out.  You think and fear the worse, but it isn't always the worst news.  Good luck xxx Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: One more day to go.

Posts.Content: Well at least you haven't got another wait yo start chemo I suppose, that really would be rubbing salt in wound. Good luck for Friday. I'll lett you know when I hear, although I feel like that may never happen, it's very bizarre. I'm thinking of you. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: Hi mizz59 I too am waiting for my oncotype Dx results, I'm hoping I'll get them this week. My oncologist said three week wait and its three weeks on weds, good grief the waiting is pants! I had my surgery in March and I had an invasive mixed tumour of both ductal and lobular. Do you know when your results are due? Let's hope neither of us need chemo. Sending you good wishes and I hope your results come back very soon and very low!! Kathy xx
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothy so in theory we could both hear this week! I haven't started my anastrazole yet as my oncologist starts you on them the day you finish all your treatment. Waiting for the phone to ring is a test in itself isn't it! On a lighter note, our tumours could be side by side in a lab, getting the bejesus beaten out of them! It's probably way more scientific than that (!!!!) but it comforts me that someone is hurting it, just like its been hurting me! I'll send you a friend request, and we can chat more privately if you would prefer. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: Oh bu@@er! I'm so sorry to hear that. How are you feeling ? Although I probably don't need to ask. I just had a call from the RT team to arrange my planning appointment and my heart skipped a beat as I thought, the results are in and we are under way! 5 mins later she rang back, it was a mistake, no results back. Let me know how you are getting on Dorothy, thinking of you . Much love Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: waiting for oncotype-dx results

Posts.Content: I agree Ali.  Just after my op, I saw something on TV re BC, it showed you how to check yourself which was brilliant, but after listening to do, this don't do that, got really upset as they made me feel like I'd given it to myself, which I flipping didn't!  I was probably being hyper sensitive but after going through this,cxxp im trying to live a balanced happy life, not an anorexic tea total one! Xx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi weeble I noticed that you'd said on the MC thread you'd had a day off from the hot sweats and was going to ask how you were doing with them, I was going to say has the gabapentin started working but perhaps it's a combo of that and the diet? Let's hope so!  Kxx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: I agree Ali.  Just after my op, I saw something on TV re BC, it showed you how to check yourself which was brilliant, but after listening to do, this don't do that, got really upset as they made me feel like I'd given it to myself, which I flipping didn't!  I was probably being hyper sensitive but after going through this,cxxp im trying to live a balanced happy life, not an anorexic tea total one! Xx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi weeble I noticed that you'd said on the MC thread you'd had a day off from the hot sweats and was going to ask how you were doing with them, I was going to say has the gabapentin started working but perhaps it's a combo of that and the diet? Let's hope so!  Kxx
Posts.Title: Measures to prevent breast cancer recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi ladies I too had lumpectomy and nodes removed three weeks ago today. I get my path results tomorrow and I'm just beginning to work myself up into a lather! Was supposed to get them last Friday but it got postponed. I've got to say I've found the node op much more painful than lump op, it's been the gift that keeps on giving! I know already that I'm ER and PR positive and they've mentioned tamoxifen. So it looks like we three are all on a similar path at the mo. My armpit is also numb but I think that is improving slightly. I have found that the underside of my arm from armpit to near my elbow has also been really tender, bit like bad sunburn, so I'm thinking that's possible nerve damage/repair. Well I'm off to try and keep busy, the stress is v high today. Would love to hear how you are both getting on and feeling. Love and hugs to you. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: Hi scribbling lady, I'm afraid I don't know but I thought I'd respond to bump your post.  I think there's been a bit of an issue with the site, I'm sure there's someone out there that will give you some info.  Good luck with it all and I hope it isn't too bad.  Love. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: repair to lumpy scar

Posts.Content: Oh that's the best news!  Enjoy your celebration.  Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Fantastic News!

Posts.Content: Good luck today. I hope it's good news for you. I think we all feel the same with pains and niggles but if you are worried then tell someone don't just stew on it. Let us know how you get on. The waiting is pants isn't it! Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: ha

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, thanks for your support through this. Yes, yet another wait! I'm hoping I don't have to have chemo, but feel like a weight has been lifted off me already! Whatever the score we are v lucky to have our treatment more or less tailor made to our cancer. I also like the thought that they might be making it into some kind of cancer smoothie as I'd quite like to have beaten it with a rolling pin myself! Yep, I'm definitely losing the plot, well that's always assuming I had it to start with! Hope you are having a good day, Janet. Love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: My test was funded!

Posts.Content: Just wanted to say good luck to you both and that I'm thinking of you especially Sandy. Hope to see you soon at the Hummingbird. Kathryn (and of course Jim!) Xxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed triple negative starting Chemo 1st May

Posts.Content: Exactly George ! The Macmillan nurse even commented that she could see we'd done our homework and I just wasn't getting anywhere until you worked your magic! So a big hug back to you too! AAah a holiday, that is my carrot on a stick that's keeping me going. Much love, Kathy xx
Posts.Title: My test was funded!

Posts.Content: hi ladies I just wanted to share my good news with you. I've had the Oncotype dx test funded by the NHS, apparently it has literally just been adopted by the NHS. You have to fit a certain criteria, which luckily I do and so my tumour is on a one way ticket to the usa to be tested against 21 genes. I get the results in 3 weeks and then dependant on the results, my treatment can begin. It's hoped that by having the test they can avoid over treating us with chemo. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: My test was funded!

Posts.Content: Hopefully I'm first in a long line of us who are going to benefit. My onco said for every 100 women in my position (borderline for chemo) that they give chemo to there's the possibility that only four will truly benefit. So as you said mistymoley there will be big benefits all round. Let's hope the funding continues. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: My test was funded!

Posts.Content: That is so lovely to hear, got my first onco appt on weds and she wants to discuss chemo and the Oncotype dx test. Am hoping I can just get away with rads but when I see a post like yours, it makes me feel that if I have to have chemo then I can get through it. Well done you. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: at last I've had my results! It's been almost 6 weeks as some numpty left the request sitting on the system for over two weeks. But it's been worth the wait as I don't have to have chemo, I can go straight to rads, yay! I don't know what my score is as my bcn is on leave, but hey I've avoided chemo and for that I'm truly grateful. Got my planning appt on Monday and at last I'm taking steps towards the end of treatment. Happy Friday or what! Xxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx results ...

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies for all the good advice, it's so great to have this from people that have done it and got the tee shirt! Going by past history of waiting times, I'm thinking I'll get the three week wait, but you never know, they could be about to astound me! Which hospital do you attend shaz15? Grannylara, little Susie and I are at coventry's university hospital, don't think we get complimentary drinks as Costa have a big presence in our hospital. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx results ...

Posts.Content: Hi beachhutter ring your bcn re chemo dates, it's horrible not knowing. I'm currently exploring ways to get some sleep.  Go out if you want and stay in if you want, nobody knows how you feel but you so you call the shots honey.  Xx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Thanks George, am I right in thinking I have a scan and then the tattoos? Do you know if they then have to go away and do calculations or once I've had that appointment they know on the day what they want to do and can get on give me an appointment?  I'm ever hopeful that I won't have another long wait for the actual appointments, but this cancer malarkey seems all about the waiting, so I'm not holding my breath! do you think its free parking for your planning appt or just the rads?   I still can't quite believe I've dodged that bullet, as I've had it hanging over my head since 17 April, I'm not ashamed to say I was crying for a good half an hour with relief after the news, I was obviously a lot more stressed about it than I thought. so good news is all about perspective isn't it, I can't wait for them to turn my boob into a rasher (or family pack!) of cooked streaky bacon as it signals the end of that particular road. thanks for being such a star, little Susie, grannylara and I were all singing your praises yesterday, when we had a lovely afternoon tea.  Xx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx results ...

Posts.Content: Oh thank you Janet. You too! Kxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx results ...

Posts.Content: Thanks so much. Xx I also have three lovely daughters and two gorgeous grandchildren and my husband has been beyond brilliant, so I totally hear what you are saying. I'm so ready to kick cancers butt and amazing ladies like you inspire me on, it's the flaming waiting that's been dragging me down these last couple of weeks but I've felt more like my old self today and you have just put the icing on the cake. Thank you xx Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Having a lovely weekend

Posts.Content: Oh P J so sorry you feel low. Like others have said the waiting is the worst part it's total pants.  Be good to yourself.  Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Hi beachhutter, perhaps don't make big plans?  Just something that's going to take 30/45 mins?  Don't know how old your children are, but am presuming youngish, so perhaps a trip, by car to the local park and take a treat with you,  wear the kids out while you sit on the bench eating Ferraro rocher!  How old are they?  I've got three but they are all in their 30s so it's my two grand kids that wear me out! Or get someone to take the kids to the park and you have a soak in the bath with a glass of wine, candles and chocs. A little of what you fancy does you good babe. Kxxx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: I think me and you are on the same page where indulgence is involved Susie!
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Go for the soaking in the bath every night then beachhutter, perhaps treat yourself to something like Himalayan salts for you bath, I've seen it hem in sainsbos for £6.00 for a big pack, gonna get some today for myself as I'm back on the baths now post radiotherapy. Glad you spoke to your bcn, leave as much worry as you can at her door.   It must be hard for you  with young children and even harder when you have a child with a disability, have you got family friends who could "divide and conquer" with the children, ie perhaps have one at a time to give you and them a break?  It's not,the same but having three little girls, I had three in under four years, I understand a bit as three is definitely a crowd, even if they are just their usual boisterous selves. Try not to look at this cancer cxxp as a big mountain to climb, maybe just on an hour by,hour basis or if you feel good, a day by day basis.   Keep posting honey, throw your all your cares and woes at us, I don't know much, but some people on here are amazing with their,knowledge and life experiences, you are amongst friends here beachhutter so use us. Much love and hugs Kathy xxxx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: You are so welcome and, you have the same name as my middle daughter,although we spell hers Ellenor! Glad you got out of the house as well. I guessed by your name you had a beach hut, as I live in land locked rugby but am originally an Essex girl, it's the sea that I miss most. You are in a big gang of us struggling with fatigue and tiredness so you are not isolated or alone on here honey. Hope you are having a good day. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: feeling fed up and down

Posts.Content: Wow didn't know people could get that! Sounds horrid. There are so many viruses out there. Have you tried voltarol cream on your hands at night?  It last for 12 hours.  I've got a torn cartilage in my knee and it can be quite effective. Your gp can prescribe and it doesn't upset your tummy. Get into the miserable cows club as well and moan/moo your head off.  Some of us, well mainly me, are thinking of running away to the circus or starting our own, I'm gonna be the freak show and weeble's the clown and Mrs d is putting her dog in.  Well it's either that or the looney bin!  Much love. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Joint pain update

Posts.Content: We've just had the M&S two dine for £10.00, which I think was a Spanish chicken dish, followed by trifle, barely a calorie in that! and even better as my lovely husband cooked it. Xxx
Posts.Title: What a difference

Posts.Content: Your hair looks lovely xx
Posts.Title: Took the plunge and went to hairdressers today ...

Posts.Content: Well done Susie xxx hope the prof didn't keep you waiting too long xxx
Posts.Title: Another Neddy passes the finish post!

Posts.Content: Congratulations fifi! I had oncotype Dx test and as dream thief coined it "I dodged the chemo bullet" ! I hope you are also lucky xx Kathy
Posts.Title: NEDdy

Posts.Content: Good luck to everyone doing the race! My daughter is also doing it on 7 June in northampton and I'm hoping I will be able to go along shout and holler as she crosses the finish line! Kathy x
Posts.Title: Race for Life

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, sorry you've been diagnosed and I think those first weeks are horrible. I got a call back on mammogram on 19 February and they told me there and then it was cancer. It's almost like they are talking about someone else. I've got to say though my treatment so far has been first class and you are in good hands with the nhs. I've only joined this group two days ago and I've read as much as I can on all the BC threads and it's not only informative it's also uplifting and on here you are normal, everyone has been through the diagnosis process and can offer advice. I wish I'd joined sooner, and so in that respect you are ahead of me. I'm recovering from lump removal and main lymph node removal. I have, or maybe had(!) invasive ductal and lobular tumour. I've got my results appointment on Friday, which can't come soon enough! Good luck with everything and let me/us know how you are getting on. Kathyx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and need to read something positive

Posts.Content: Is that a rule or best practice that rads must start 12 weeks after surgery? I'm 12 weeks today and still awaiting my results (oncotype dx).? Kathy xx
Posts.Title: ctscan

Posts.Content: Thanks for the reply kateand biz, my bcn rang and I asked her, she said ideally 12 weeks but that I just had to sit tight and wait for test results, which I'm hoping will arrive next week, but I've been saying that for weeks now! Oh well they will get here eventually! Hope you have a good weekend. Kathy x
Posts.Title: ctscan

Posts.Content: Hi Nina, sorry you had bad news, but you sound like you are in good hands. I had a Breast mri and it was fine. They put a little needle thing in your vein in your arm, then you lay face down with your boobs in two holes/cage things. Get comfy before they begin, you have your face in a padded hole, like you would if you were having a back massage. Then they scan you, bit noisy but ok, then for last 5 mins or less the put some contrast dye in, it feels warm, but again doesn't hurt. I think you would be ok to go on your own by why not ask someone to go with you, just in case you have to wait about or need a cuddle. I hope you get on ok honey, and sending positive vibes out to you and cyber hugs. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: That's amazing news, and so great to hear. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Result of first mammogram today ...

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce, I. So glad you are turning a corner with the healing.  If the double base is ok for you, you can also get a wash, which is also very good.  Enjoy your break honey. Kxx
Posts.Title: Peeling like a snake!!

Posts.Content: That is interesting as my oncologist wants to talk to me about chemo and the Oncotype dx test, it's apparently going to cost £3,500. What was your experience of the test? Regards, Kathyx
Posts.Title: Interesting news

Posts.Content: Thanks Janet, apparently as the test hasn't yet been adopted by NICE then I will have to pay and it appears to have gone up by £1000. I'm trying not to preempt what the oncologist will say, but also gather information and peoples experience so I can ask some relevant questions before I spend 6 months salary! Kathyxx
Posts.Title: Interesting news

Posts.Content: Wow that's quite a through put of people isn't it! My rads team say e45 or aqueous and only aqueous with no SLS in it, but basically nothing with any metals like zinc or aluminium as it scatters the beams.  They are happy with deodorant wearing too but I'm not having my lymph nodes blasted.  It's so interesting to hear all the differences. Hope you don't have too painful a weekend , Joyce.  Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Thanks weeble, think you are going to have to do something special for your 50th.  I'm 58 today and one of my daughters said we should start planning my 60th! On the one hand I'm grateful that I've got that choice, on the other hand, I'm sure they aren't talking about me whose going to be 60, surely that's a mistake? I'm 35 max!!!
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Thanks buddy, I think we need to plan our next get together when I'm fully microwaved! Xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I know what a joy and I haven't even started anastrazole !  I feel like I'm revving up to be one of those moaning old gits, you know, ooh me knees, ooh me hip, ooh I never get a full nights sleep, but like you say, it's better than the alternative.  Good job we can laugh at ourselves.  Much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi margy and Joyce, well for the first time, I went in early!  I nearly fell over.  Margy glad your appt went well, that is very thorough, I don't think I've had a blood test since my pre op.  I take those tablets as I too had low vit d, they are adcal and also contain calcium, which is a bonus in our situation.  Oh ladies, I'm so glad I've got the weekend off, and then just three more zaps.  I'm so over going back and forth every day, I feel like I work there! I'm pretty pink tonight but that's been the same every night, but by the time I've whacked the Aloe on it it really calms down.  Enjoy your weekends my rad sisters, much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi margy and Joyce glad you are both getting on ok.  No 13 was ok, but saw my bcn and the tissue viability nurse who,both said I was too pink.  The TV Nurse slathered me in some gel, put gauze on then a pad then a boob tube thing made out of disposable knickers with the gusset cut out and turned into,straps.  It was quite a look!  She sent me home with more gel with instructions to repeat before bed.   As we speak, I've washed the whole lot off and binned the dressings as I was so itchy that it was driving me nuts.  I had a bad experience with dressings after my op, which I was allergic to and my whole boob blistered, and this had shades of that experience.  When I took it off it was all red and angry, so I've put my double base back on and it's all stopped itching and appears to be calming down a bit so I'm putting that one down to experience!  Can't wait for weds appt to be over even though the cooking continues at least I'll be at home. Thank you both for thinking of me, I'm also thinking of you both.  Much love  Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Evening ladies, I've had a lovely day.  I went and had my hair done, which is always a very pleasurable experience and when I went to pay, they said nope it's already been paid for by your daughters, I was really surprised and obviously got very choked up and so did the hairdressers!  Then I went and met one of my work buddies for a coffee and a walk round the shops.  Then Jim and I went for a walk along the canal in the sunshine.  I couldn't walk as far as I wanted to as I'm wearing a baggy bra as I'm very swollen and there was too much jiggleage which was rubbing where I didn't want to be rubbed!  I am layering on the double base as often as I can and I can't believe how my skin is absorbing it.  I'm getting a lot of shooting pains but I'm thinking at least I know the rads are doing something.  Oh and the post man brought me a present from my daughter who lives in London, it's an original watercolour/ink by the London street artis John Lloyd of his dog George.  She got him to date it yesterday to mark the end of my treatment, I got all choked up again! I'm feeling very blessed xxx. Joyce you can definitely achieve your 7lb goal be kind to yourself until the radiotherapy is out of your system and then go for it.  Is your head any better now? There's a pressure point on your hands it's the chunky bit under your thumb, massage that on both hands and also try opening your mouth as wide as you can and holding it for a second or two and repeating a couple of times, in case you have tnsion in your jaw.  Hope you enjoyed your walk xx much love. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce and margi, it all went well really. My appointment wasn't until 4pm so the waiting today was a bit pants but I'm feeling much more confident about it all now. Thanks again ladies for your support. I can feel my cooking beginning over my scar, no pain but a definite hot area, how bizarre! Glad your pain has improved Joyce, but don't be a hero. Well onwards now, number two tomorrow. Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Oh Joyce that is fantastic! You put in a lot of hard work and you deserve that success.  I hope you and Hubble are giving yourselves a massive pat on the back.  Glad to hear that your skin is ok too.  Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi ladies,, so 2 done and feel I'm in the groove now. Margy you sound like you've got it nailed!  Joyce that sounds horrible! Do ibuprofen take the pain away? I'm glad they put your mind at ease. Are you very red on the outside? My rads guy, young and fit, wouldn't you know it, said whatever's going on outside is the same inside so perhaps it's v inflamed.? Well two days off! Yay !! Hope you have a great weekend.  Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: How are you now Joyce?  My skin is trying to be red but I'm managing to keep it undear control, it's the inside that's been giving me grief today.  I really feel that today it's ramped right up and it's a week since I finished today.  Also about two nights ago I think an extremely elderly African woman, crept in and swapped one of her nipples for one of mine!  If I find her she's getting this dark brown wrinkly, sore excuse for a nipple right back!  Xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I got mine from Holland and Barrett and one with cucumber as well in it. Used it on my husbands burnt knees at the weekend! You can apparently use it as a cleanser as well. I'm post menopause too, but not allowed to take anastrazole until day after I finish rads. Glad to hear you are ok on your AI, it gives me hope! Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Have you tried chilled aloe Vera?  It really is very soothing and does take the heat out.  Holland and Barrett sell a good pure one.  Also frozen peas in a tea towel?  Hope it's better very soon.  Kxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce the scones sound soooo nice! Glad you got your tablets and that you are doing ok today, hopefully you've had your share of the pain.  I had my 3rd zap today, am pink and tingly but so far so good.  We will be thoroughly cooked before we know it.  Love Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, well done you two, I'm so envious that you are both so far along now.  I've just done no. 5 so 10 to go!  I too had a sleepless night, after going to bed shattered, so perhaps it's the rads? I've got a v tender nipple  and I'm getting very pink but the gel seems to be working so far!  Let's see what tomorrow brings.  It's been a funny old birthday today though,  I didn't think last birthday that I'd be facing cancer this year.  It's a funny old world sure enough.  Much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Wow! So nearly at the finish line!, well done margy!!  I've got a 4.20 appt again today, and am hoping there's no delays but as it's been every day this week I won't be entirely surprised.  My nipple is also the sorest part, the rest is fine so far, but I'm putting the gel on a lot.  Have a lovely weekend. Kxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce, you are nearly there girl! I'm at the halfway point today, yay! My machine was v late as well but that's been everyday since last Monday, but hey ho, what else would I be doing. Wow you are doing so well with your skin honey, they took me off aqueous and put me on double base, and said today it looks pink and did I want to see the tissue viability nurse, but I feel like I've got it under control so I said leave it and see what tomorrow brings, I've also apparently got a patch of prickly heat, but it's not really bothering me so I'm just ignoring it.  I do feel like someone's pulled my plug out tonight though.  Oh your cake baking is really sounding good, I've never made a bake well tart, is it difficult?  How many people are you expecting at your do? God luck tomorrow honey. Kxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, well done margy, you will be making a hole in your prosseco by now!  Good luck With the next couple of weeks.  Joyce you should go on bake off! You are painfully close to finishing honey, the end of the treatment road is in sight !  I've done no 9 today, so double figures tomorrow, yay!, I'm pink and hot and quite knackered but it's all doable.  Hope you have a good session tomorrow.  Much love Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Oh well done Joyce. Xxx I'm not surprised you felt emotional, I think I will too.  We've got to build up our confidence going forward.  I'm seeing the nurse on Monday so I hope I get the nipple patch, that's pretty tender. Enjoy your long weekend honey, and spoil yourself, you deserve it. Xxx much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hiya Joyce, yes just got back! Can't believe it's over, we are just off out for a meal to celebrate and have some bubbly in the fridge for later.  Skin not too bad, dropped a letter into docs asking for more double base and double base wash, so I think that will all be great for me.  Went and bought anti slip mat for shower as my track record for falling over is not good, and the wash makes everything mega slippy!  Have also been asked to take part in a trial about after care when treatment ends, so will have a read up and decide.  Sounds ok though, they said they know there should be something after treatment but they are trying to gauge what would help us.  I'll let you know what I decide and a bit more info if you or anyone else is interested.  I'm so glad you are doing well Joyce, long may it continue.  They told me today that feeling down and tearful is also a side effect of the rads and that it will continue for at least a month, I wasnt aware of that.  Keep me posted on the tea party.  Much love. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Thanks Jenny, that's a damn fine idea about celebrating, I'm celebrating everything at the moment.  Start my anastrazole tomorrow and am now expecting the weight to drop off! Well I can always hope! If we don't speak, hope you have a wonderful time.  Kathy xxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Try not to over do it Joyce, you have put so much hard work into it already, I'm sure it's going to be a roaring success xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Thanks Joyce and margi, you are good mentors for me! I know once it's going on then I'll just be stoic and get on with it but it's been a flipping long time coming as I had my op on 26 March, then had the oncotype Dx test which took ages to come through, but I was lucky and dodged chemo. I've probably had too much time to think about it, and I know it sounds a daft thing to say but you have the treatment in the cancer centre and I usually live in la la land and the treatment makes me face cancer. I still have moments of "I'm sure they've made a mistake, it can't be me they are talking about!" It's the gift that keeps on giving ladies isn't it! Best wishes for tomorrow's treatment. Love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I know, I picked up my anastrazole today and as my machine was running 25 mins late, I read the leaflet to my husband about side effects, I've already got some of them and I haven't started it yet!! I'm looking forward to hearing what you have baked tomorrow. I might do a sponge, just to get my groove back. Do you think the shoulder ache could be tension and then holding your arms up while you are zapped? I find I keep clenching my jaw, so obviously I'm more stressed than I think. Perhaps we should both book some complimentary therapy. Good luck tomorrow honey. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Well done Joyce, so glad the pain has gone and it's all going in the right direction.  Enjoy your weekend honey, just off to get ready for my appointment.  Love. Kathy xxx,
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I know they know best, but I think they might have over reacted as I felt it was under control and get plenty of relief from the aloe and my double base. Can't believe how much better it feels already. Thanks buddy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow Joyce, let us know how it goes xxx Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Glad your rads are underway Joyce, mine start on Thursday and am getting butterflies, so I'm reading these posts with interest. Good luck ladies.  Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Is that 4 out of 15 rads margym? I'm also very fair skinned, practically pale blue in some areas! I hope you can keep all the symptoms in check. I'm trying to keep busy and not over think my first one on Thursday, it's not until 4pm so a bit of a crappy time really, got all day to stress about it! Much love Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Well done Joyce ! You'll be an expert by the time I start on Thursday. Hope the breast pain isn't too bad. Love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Well done margy you'll be halfway tomorrow! Have you got any aloe Vera gel in the fridge? Apparently it's great for taking the heat out of your boob. This time next month we will all be finished our rads, then just the dreaded anastrazole for me! Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: So,that sounds similar to adcal too. Let us know whether or not you get the alendronic acid as well. Hope you have a good week. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi margy, I think it is pretty normal for us to carry on cooking for two weeks, that what my rad team told me.  Glad you are doing well.  I had my bone scan about 5/6 weeks ago and I haven't heard anything either, but am seeing my onco bcn on 27th, so will ask her then. I'm hoping no news is good news!  Oh you are really on the home straight now girl! Glad your symptoms are not too bad.  Good luck tomorrow. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Joyce, sorry to hear you aren't feeling too good today, hopefully some rest might help.  Margy, you really are on the back end of it all now!  I had number 4 today and am even pinker and very tingly with the odd shooting pain.  But on the whole not too bad.  They've told me to only use aqueous cream to wash with from now on and given me double base cream to use 4 x times a day, I feel the cooking of my boob is definitely underway now.,  margy are you someone who goes brown easily then? I'm not, I go from lobster to peeling then back to being pale blue again, so it would be very novel for me to have a brown boob!  I guess we'll see what happens.  Feel better soon Joyce, and good luck to you both for tomorrow. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: And if it hadn't been for this shxxxy disease we would never have met, so up your bum cancer, some good has come out of it! Xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi ladies! so glad you are all doing well. Thank you for all my birthday good wishes, we went out for dinner again tonight as my middle daughter is staying with us until next weds, which is lovely.  So that's no. 6  I've just finished, my machine was running 30 mins late today and I was literally the last chicken in sainsburys today, not another patient in the place, but at the moment it's all feeling better than expected.  They changed me to double base gel on Tuesday and I think it's really helping.  I've still got a nuclear glowing nipple though, bet that beauty's gonna peel!  Joyce glad you are back well enough to bake again and it's always good when you have a revamp indoors isn't it.  I'm looking forward to having the weekend off from hospital, aren't you!  Good luck tomorrow ladies.  Much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi margy, I think we've still got cooking going on when we stop the rads for the next couple of weeks, so I hope you get your sunder control.  I'm getting a lot of relief from the chilled aloe Vera gel.  Yes only four more to go! Bet it feels weird not going as I'm building my whole day around it.  Take it easy honey and stay cool!  Love Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce sounds like you have the right idea today and the weather is horrible too.  Glad you are not too uncomfortable, I was given a couple of tubes of double base gel and then got my gp to prescribe a big pump bottle of it, which I am using generously, otherwise I've had to buy everything else, I'm going to mention the cooling pads when I see the nurse on Monday.  Your home is going to look super duper when you are finished, I bet you are very excited to see the end result.  I'm glad you enjoyed your meal out as well, it's funny marking the end of something that we've had no control over isn't it, but it's a milestone, that's for sure.  Enjoy the rest of your day, I'm just getting ready for my appointment now, zap no. 12 about to bite the dust.  Much love.  Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: I can't believe that there's no hospital tomorrow, I'm feeling a bit like its the start of the holidays.  So glad you are doing well margy.  It's nice to know that 8 days after you are ok, and long may it continue.  Susie you'll have to put a lolly stick in each ear to stop you falling down drain holes if you lose much more weight!  Well done you! I'm enjoying a glass of bubbly now and the start of my freedom! Much love to you all. Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce and margi, thanks so much for your good wishes, it's very much appreciated. I keep thinking this time tomorrow I'll be underway, unless they move the appointment, which is something that could definitely happen to me! Hope you both feel ok tomorrow too. Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi Joyce, so glad you've had a better weekend honey. Half way means you are on the home straight !! I take the calcium tablets as I've got low vit D and you can't have one without the other. They are adcal and you chew them. I was a bit dubious but they are no problem. I think there's also another one that you take weekly, but so far I've avoided that. I've been fine this weekend and getting zap number 3 on Monday, it will also be my first 5 days of treatment without a break, so a little apprehensive about side effects. You are a glutton for punishment! Well done though, I haven't got my nerve up to commit to anything yet. Keep us posted as to how your baking progresses and you might inspire me! I've got my sister bringing my mum to see me tomorrow, they live two hours away, so I'm looking forward to that, even though it will be a quick visit as I'll have to go and get zapped. Then it's my birthday on Wednesday, so I'm focussing on the good stuff and hoping my boob doesn't end up glowing like a beacon guiding people in! Good luck tomorrow Joyce, and margy. Much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi margy and Joyce, yep I've done 10 now!  Feel tired today and have shooting pains also, so I've cancelled my friend tomorrow and I'm going to have a lazy bra free day to try and help the tenderness.  Like you Joyce I too have quite big boobs so will not be going outside the house! Enjoy your celebration lunch tomorrow, we are going to do something next weds but as all mine are so late, it'll be dinner. My machine was 50 mins late today, I think I'll fall over if I go in on time, but the team are lovely and it's not their fault.  I'm back looking at holidays again, we just want a break not too far away, my daughter and friend were telling me about Croatia so I'm going to investigate.  Good luck. For your last one tomorrow Joyce, and margy I hope the continued cooking of your boob doesn't get too sore. Much love Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Glad you said that Susie, I thought it was me being too sensitive.  What did she give you after that and if so was it any good? Xx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Hi ladies well Joyce you are seriously packing a lot in! It all sounds so exciting too.  Margy, I'd fall over if my bcn rang me, nice enough woman but ..... Well ,least said etc! Ive had another brilliant day, been at my daughters all day with the grandchildren and then Victoria cooked a celebratory meal, beef Wellington with all the trimmings and Ava and I made chocolate brownies for desert, more champagne And my son In law bought me a beautiful bouquet, which made me cry, again!  Boob more tender inside than out really, I'm still laying the cream on, but nothing too bad, let's hope it carries on like that.  Oh and just done two days on my anastrazole, so far so good! Have a great weekend everyone.  Much love. Kathyxxx
Posts.Title: Feeling better

Posts.Content: Good luck to you both, I'm the same as Joyce and have just finished my rads.  I had a mixed tumour of invasive ductal and lobular which was 25mm, grade 2. I had WLE and sentinel lymph node surgery in March.  My lymph nodes were clear and my tumour was ER+ with a score the same as yours 8:8 so I have just started anastrazole.  I didn't need chemo as they sent my tumour off to USA and it was tested using the oncotype Dx test and it came back that it would respond better to hormone therapy.  Where you both are now seems a long road and the worst part is the waiting for things to happen, but you can do it and once it's all underway, you'll feel better and before you know it, you'll be the other side of treatment waiting to be told you are a NEDDY, just like Joyce and I.  Joyce and I and another lady margy have all supported each other through rads and we are all here to support you if you need it. With love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: understanding letter received by GP

Posts.Content: We did Route 66 (Chicago to LA) for our 30th and it was amazing but it's a lot of driving which we also love,  it's real old town America with the old ma and pa diners but it's not really relaxing.  I also love Vegas but that's not everyone's cup of tea either.  So do you like to lay by the pool or get out and explore ? You can do,both in Vegas , with sun block of course, as you've got Grand Canyon and loads of other stuff fairly nearby. Xx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Ooh sounds yummy! My current favourite chocolates are the "Pralines Superieurs" lovely Belgian chocolate sea shells, oh and they are from Lidl. If you like truffle style chocs you'll love these. Kathy x
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: Ooh they sound lovely too! Kxx
Posts.Title: The perfect chocolate

Posts.Content: So where would that be if you had a choice then weeble? Xx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Oh yes Ali owl and Barcelona has a beach, shops museums.  Very good idea and not too,far away.  Kxx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: I can recommend German red wine weeble, a big surprise to me! So only need to find a sausage substitute ... Ooh matron! Xxx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: You are so worth it though xxx we've been married 37 years in January and when you think of what we paid for our first little house, people would pay more for a new car!  Kxx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Sounds like another nice holiday to plan then Susie xxx
Posts.Title: My wedding ring

Posts.Content: Hi smoothie, that sounds like a nightmare appointment! Was your bcn there with you? I would ring her and ask her all those questions and say you weren't happy with the experience, as that doc shouldn't be let loose on people yet! Re the pain, mine lasted ages, but tell your bcn and don't do too much too soon. Having chemo hanging over your head is pants, I had it hanging over me from 17april until last Friday and it nearly drove me nuts. I was offered and had the oncotype dx test which has now come back as no chemo, so the wait was worth it. I hope you get some answers and some pain relief, and do have a good cry if you want to, I know I have and it does release the pressure. Much love Kathy xx
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: It sounds like a great day out Susie, I hope your rad went well today and you weren't kept hanging around too long. Kxx
Posts.Title: It seemed like a good idea at the time!!

Posts.Content: There's also the royal marsden cancer cook book, which is great. Breaks down recipes for during and after treatment. You can get it on amazon. Kxx
Posts.Title: Marker clip and chemo?

Posts.Content: Welcome and a big hug 58petals, before you know it, you will be posting advice to other people on here, although that seems hard to believe at the moment as you are at the beginning of your journey.  But we have all been where you are and understand that today it's as if you are looking up at a mountain to climb, but you have lots of helping hands to get you to,the top and down the other side.  That all sounded a bit poetic, sorry, will have to go for a lie down now! Much love. Kathy xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed yesterday...

Posts.Content: Well done buddy! Xxx
Posts.Title: I did it too!
